8GtygSO2v7W7ykflakfsXQ.text: Was searching for cafe with airconditioning in Katong and this was one of those that came up. Great ambience, good coffee, delicious waffles, fabulous airconditioning. Came across their shop name in some coffee/food guide online and realized this was a branch of the original shop in Duxton. It's located in a relatively new Hotel cum tiny Mall. Katong area is known for its tough/painful parking experience. Was really surprised to find many parking lots in the mall/hotel outdoor parking. Major plus point. Another mall slightly further up, 112 Katong, parking is a complete pain. Ordered a Latte, Mocha, Almond Roasted Latte, Orange Juice and two waffles for about $50. Pretty pricey but definitely not a deterrence to many. The shop was running full for the two hours that we were there. The coffee were fragrant and absolutely delicious, the strength of coffee and balance of milk is awesome. The waffles were really good too.Would definitely recommend this place for all the factors (coffee, food, aircon, parking). One star short for the high price tag.

FHqyz1A4mpsBplUVHuCMGw.text: Just about average - coffee acceptable but nothing to write home about, food options similarly a bit bland. Prices actually quite decent, friendly service is a redeeming factor. I kind of prefer the cafe upstairs tbh.

Ovx8CdCnqZu1HGacHWkK6w.text: This is my favourite cafe! No qualms about this. It is so underrated. They sell food with a heart. It is moderately priced but the portions are good. Non pretentious and honestly tasty food. I love the handmade granola bowl and warm oats with fresh fruits. I was also once addicted to their bacon aglio olio. The caramel cappucino and roasted almond latte literally soothe your soul. The Katong branch is rather quiet during weekday evenings and exceptionally crowded on weekends. But this place is an AWESOME gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Granola bowl

2BNWhjr5bQ3una5U8cIMLg.text: The eastern branch of their original outlet at Duxton, this outlet does not disappoint. Generous portions, great breads and I do love a good homemade hollandaise sauce. They are also very accommodating in customizing my orders, which is great.Love their coffees too, which is rich, robust and full-bodied. None of that tannic aftertaste. On lucky days, you may also get homemade yummy baked goods from the owner's mum secret recipe. The only thing gripe I have about this place is that it is located within a mall, which takes away a lot of its personality, unlike its sister outlet at Duxton. You'll be surprised how busy it gets with the expat crowd who lives in the east every morning, even on weekdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Carbonara

WT37aCuLLPBrGMvIyxmchg.text: Quite a few people were sad when they left their Everitt Road location, so I'm glad that these guys have resurfaced in the neighbourhood! Well kinda... it's not EXACTLY the same, but Katong's just down the road, right? This new spot in a spiffy new mall, and it's not the most obvious, but it seems like that how cafes like it now... if you're coming in by East Coast Road/"The Roxy Square Side*", then you'll want to walk the the other end of NTUC Finest. If you're coming in from Marine Parade/"The Parkway Parade Side*", then you're looking to go one level down from the street. It's a decent 40-ish seater spot, so you're all right to come by unannounced... for a while, before it's discovered by the hoards.They've got a more generous menu akin to the mothership in Duxton, so that's a welcome upgrade from RG. I got some Crispy Corn Croquettes with my capp this morning, and that made for a fun snack. The croquettes come with a deadly Japanese sesame salad dressing as a dipping sauce - I'm a mad sucker for that stuff, so I gobbled it all up.Lots of expats here too (it's Katong lah) so it makes for a cool people-watching spot as you pretend to tap away at your keyboard!

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Crispy corn croquettes
Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

lrvfL4zLYqQeaGiAyVnJpQ.text: Meh... I'm underwhelmed by the $8 root beer float. I ran out of root beer before my ice cream melted. Having 'fun' trying to eat the remaining ice cream with a straw as apparently a spoon was too far fetched. Ditto the missing napkins. Maybe this is meant ironically and also sustainable spiel?

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Root beer float ($8)

XO8Ov_FHmnNobOrqxF4kkA.text: The cafe smelled amazing. All you could smell walking into the cafe was truffle oil. Me - truffle fan - was overjoyed. The menu was pretty enticing too. Lots of great brunch choices. The sour-faced cashier took our order not too willingly. Coffee we got were flat whites. Can't go wrong with them. They were made pretty well except that it was served in a cup slightly bigger than an expresso cup. Size wise, disappointing for the $5 price tag. The food arrived pretty soon after. I had the croque madame, a sunny side up on top of two dry and thick pieces of bread with ham bacon and a measly amount of cheese. This is not how you do a croque Madame. No way. The cheese was pathetic, they were so stingy with it that it didn't even ooze out. Usually a croque Madame would have some béchamel sauce and cheese melted on it. Nope. This was dry, tasteless and not worth $16. The sarnies I make (and I don't cook much) are way better. Really not cool to disappoint someone who wanted great brunch. My friend had the poached eggs with smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce. The sauce was not too bad but the eggs were overcooked. No runny egg yolks oozing out when you cut them. Well, isn't the runnier texture the point of poached eggs? We got the chicken wings too. These were just battered wings that were deep fried without any seasoning. It was a what the... moment when we bit into the chicken. Unforgivable. My take: if you want to be a coffee joint, then stick to it. Don't offer food you don't know or can't make well. The coffee here, yes. The food, never again. The cashier could do with a smile on her face too.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Great coffee. Pity the wings

ck6M49EN1SqiRXvoEZGoLg.text: Poached eggs on thick toast, salmon. Love the hollandaise sauce.Big plate - poached eggs, brioche, sausage, bacon, salad and mushrooms. I wouldn't call the toasted white bread a brioche. A bit disappointed.Roasted almond latte - nice flavour. Poor latte art compared to chock full of beans.Americano with extra shotStill prefer chock full of beans.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Roasted almond latte
Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Americano with extra shot
Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Big plate - option of poached eggs and brioche

8JsDnWpGW1lYibfm2uLlIA.text: I love this place in the mornings.I had an assignment that lasted a week that involved a stay in Katong V hotel, and where do I hang out for my coffee fixes?Group therapy.A little too cosy when its packed,  but hey, as long as I get my cuppa, I'm happy and I give hugs.Had a number of chances to try their dishes and kept coming back for more. My highlight of the day was my pulled pork sandwich. I asked for takeout and even with that, I had people coming up to me exclaiming "oh my god! It looks so yummy!"  to proclaiming "I have to try this!!"And the best part was I haven't even taken it out of the plastic box. Cheese baked on top of the pulled pork with mustard, and pretzel buns. The roof of my mouth was sore because of the bun but... Oh my glob.... The pork.Another day I came back and had the pancakes. Oh my glob. It was lovely. And the honey comb bits?  Ingenious.

hvRkmqq3UJ2oSPgRjjozNg.text: Rather small indoor setting at one glance, but the ambiance is pretty nice. Eclectic crowd on a Sunday morning. Enjoyed my cuppa, and lovely Hollandaise sauce to go with the Eggs Benedict - very creamy. Generous portion of smoked salmon on the brioche.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs benedict & smoked salmon with hollandaise sauce on thick slice of broiche. And a good cup of coffee.

VmUNpjBdydqXgORsEJqbGg.text: Nice cosy cafe to chill out. Relatively quiet as the mall is away from the main buzz. Love the wooden and rustic / industrial look. Coffee was good and a good selection of cakes and eats. Prices are reasonable as well.

omJxh-RNOzrW2-d76XlU8g.text: We visited the other Group Therapy a while back and really liked it - we had high expectations for this morning's visit to the one in the east and were not disappointed. The food was excellent, the service fast and the place is very family friendly (we travel with two little ones). We both had the poached eggs and everything about them was very good - the salmon and hollandaise were both really tasty. I really appreciated the service as well - they were very happy to split an orange juice for our kids, brought an extra plate for them to split a waffle without us asking and said hello to them every time they walked by to deliver food. There were several families out for breakfast with wee ones and it is obvious they don't mind catering to a family clientele.  We will definitely go back!  Looked like a fun place to grab dinner or a glass of wine in the evening too.

MpSaOm7CwxUKxPsx_NcZOA.text: GTC is probably the best cafe in this side of town. I have been trying different things on each of my visits and have been delighted with each of my orders. Highly recommended for a breezy brunch with friends on the weekend. The location is indoors but the ambiance and reasonable pricing makes up for the lack of views

oUz9z_JBbyU8AwxKBANi9Q.text: Just came back for a third time. The Roasted Almond Latte is even better the Caramel Cappuccino, who da thunk? Everything I said in my previous review remains. Some of the dishes: poached eggs and the Pancakes, can be a little filling (difficult to go finish). Overall, a top-notch cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Roasted Almond Latte! Best Seller.
